text: Nama saya Boy Tridestha. Tanggal 20 - 22 Mei 2022 yang lalu menginap di Hotel Grand Dafam Ancol Jakarta sekamar bersama Triwanto kamar nomor 1205. Karena buru-buru saya kelupaan memasukkan 3 buah kemeja yang tergantung di lemari sampai saya kembali ke Kalimantan Tengah, tepatnya Kota Pulang Pisau. Saya baru sadar kira-kira 2 minggu kemudian. Saya hubungi pihak hotel dan menanyakan perihal 3 kemeja yang tertinggal, ternyata benar kemeja saya ada dan sudah disimpan oleh pihak hotel. Saya meminta tolong agar dikirimkan via jasa pengiriman dan dengan ketulusan pihak hotel ( pak Zai) mengirimkan kepada saya di Kalimantan Tengah. Saya mengucapkan terima kasih kepada pihak Grand Dafam Hotel yang telah mengirimkan 3 buah kemeja saya yang tertinggal tempo hari sudah sampai di Pulang Pisau ( Kalimantan Tengah).

text:
We booked 4 nonsmoking rooms and were given rooms 1003, 1006, 1007, and 1008 during an easy check-in. Room 1007 badly needs attention because it smelled of cigarettes and the smell lingered on the pillows as well. The towels in the toilet of 1007 were dirty and ragged :( We didn't ask for a change because we checked in late (9.30 pm) and were too exhausted from a full day in Dufan. Fortunately, the other 3 rooms were fine.

The distance of this hotel from Dufan looks close on the map (that's why we chose Grand Dafam), but in reality, we had to ride for almost 8 km away from Dufan to reach this hotel (we started from Dufan at 8.30 pm and arrived at the lobby at 9.30 pm).

Breakfast at the Cumi-cumi Cafe is fascinating for us, as adults and kids. The lady staff is very nice and helpful. The menu is various (two thumbs up!) They served nasi uduk, nasi liwet, nasi goreng (green fried rice and seafood fried rice), gulai labu siam at the corner, takoyaki and waffles on the island table, the Lodan chicken porridge and Ancol chicken soto, slices of bread and croissants, omelettes and sunny side fried eggs, and coffee of course.
title: Breakfast at Cumi-cumi Cafe is Awesome, But Room 1007 Needs Attention!

text:
We stayed at the Grand Dafam for 2 weeks, and if we had it our way, we’d stay longer if it were possible.
The service was exceptional, Especially Deri Nama and Regina who looked after us from day 1. The daily breakfast was refreshing with cleanliness was key. Always with chef present to cook omelettes and waffles. Our favourite was the seafood spaghetti. 
The room service was spotless and any extra requests were met promptly, like more towels or extra cleaning as we had many guests over. 
The pool was clean and hygienic, only wished it was in a position with more sun. 
There was ample parking, and there was always someone by the door to open and carry your shopping on arrival. 
I’m sure all other staff deserve a mention, but Deri and Regina were the ones that looked after us most.
If I had any complaints, then maybe they could get all elevators to work faster and the chef to speed up on our room service order. 
Other than that, an excellent affordable hotel in the middle of Jakarta central and north. 
Highly recommend it. 

Happy customer, 
John Hua. 
Sydney, Australia.
title: Best 2 Weeks @ Dafam Grand Hotel

text:
Since this is my first visit to Jakarta after pandemic, I wanted to have the best experience here and This is it Voilà... I chose Grand Dafam Ancol Jakarta for my 4 days stayed and I should say I had an epic stay here, all the kind and friendly staff made me feels like I'm at home. Especially the warmth welcome from Mr. Aditya.

The room was big, bathroom clean and the location is nearby Dufan and Mangga Dua shopping centers. It fits perfectly for holidays.

And the last thing that made me feels surprised, when I had dinner at 33th Bar the view was great and the next day I had lunch at the pool side, no doubt they had superb food and great places to short-escape. 

Once again, thank you for the hospitality and I'll be back soonest.
title: Healing mode On 🤩

text:
Big hotel located in the north, conveniently only 500 meters away from the Aco/ Dufan entry. Extremely friensly staff, quick check in, spacious rooms in reasonable condition. Good housekeeping; clean, ammeneties properly refilled or replaced.  Very nice and clean pool.
So far the good expenrience.
Negatives:  For acces to executive floors only 2 elevators are availble (33 floors!!!) One was out of service/ broken, so quite a bit waiting.
Worst experience though, for dinner as well as breakfast, was the restaurant.   We decided to take the Saturday all you can eat dinner with live music.  No idea where the musicians were, but probably retired already forever.
And there was just NOTHING to eat. at 7.30 PM all dished not refilled, empty platters, un interested employees. After one hour we -a group of 5- left without having been able to eat anything.
Breakfast wasn't much better.  One un interested girl serving the egg station, and waiting in line with 10+ other people.   No bread or bread rolls to be seen, only empty plates.
When we left the restaurant with an empty stomach, 2 other groups were complaining for exactly the same reason.
title: mixed experience

owner_response.text:
Dear Willem

Thank you for choosing Grand Dafam Ancol Jakarta as your preferred hotel choice while you are staying in Jakarta. 

We would like to inform you that we take your critics and comments very seriously as it will help us improve the quality of our facilities and services. We truly regret hearing such an unpleasant experience from you and we plan to correct our mistakes so that such experience will not occur again. We would like to apologize that due to the safety our guests the elevators are under maintenance causing the elevator traffic to slow down. It is not an excuse due to the our high occupancy that our services are not up to standard especially in the Food and Beverage department. We have added more staffs and revised the wrong information that you mentioned. Your concerns are heard and we assure you that such incidents will not happen again, Once again we sincerely apologize for any discomfort caused during your stay and we hope we are able to welcome you back in the future with a much better experience.

Best Regards

General Manager
